programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders visit an upmarket retirement community, where Darrell Sheets buys a unit filled with furniture, and Jarrod Schulz takes a gamble on a safe.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Among the oddities brought in is a 1950s toy lie detector, and Chum must decide whether to make an honest offer when he takes charge of the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A shower curtain signed by Anthony Perkins from Alfred Hitchcock's classic 1960 thriller Psycho, arrives at the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les works at breakneck pace to customise a $20,000 ring, but Seth is furious when Ashley unjustifiably derails the sale.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer is furious when Seth rumbles him for trying to flog fake goods. Later, panic grips the staff as a farmer lets an animal loose in the shop.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale and the team take on one of their biggest challenges when they repair a rusty horse-drawn fuel delivery wagon.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The staff from Pawn Stars bring Rick a challenging item to restore - a nuclear missile from the 1950s.

programme.title: The Great UFO Conspiracy
programme.desc: According to a 2012 survey, more people in the UK believe in the existence of aliens than in God, and more than a quarter of people think that evidence of UFOs has been covered up by the government. In this documentary, writer and comedian Dan Schreiber sets out to track down those behind the current ET conspiracy theories, meeting some of the biggest voices in the UFO community in an attempt to find out why so many people are captivated by extraterrestrial mysteries.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Police investigate when a 16-year-old ballet dancer is murdered in her home in Portsmouth, Virginia, and detectives must question her relatives as well as her circle of friends.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny acquires inside information on a prized locker - and when she opens it, she discovers it contains information on a centuries-old secret society.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor makes a find that leads him to a basketball arena, while another bidder is not so successful and left desperate for revenge.

programme.title: Conspiracy Rising
programme.desc: An investigation into the causes of conspiracy theories, the people who believe them, and how we separate fantasies from real threats..

programme.title: Ultimate Vehicles
programme.desc: The milestones of engineering that have changed land, water, and air transport for good. This episode focuses on civil aircraft.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will want to buy a classic Rover, but have to go for a Honda-based 800 coupe. At only £650 it seems too good to be true - and when they turn up, they aren’t completely sure..

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz search for valuable antiques in a barn despite an ominous warning.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Star Trek actor William Shatner presents Mike and Frank with a list of rare items he wants them to track down for his house.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Thief - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Les is horrified when he discovers the shop has been broken into and the security system has been disabled, so he sets out to try to catch the thief.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Thief - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Golds set up an elaborate sting to catch the thief and hope they have enough evidence to involve the police.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions are at an all-time high in the store as Seth and Les tussle for power and Ashley intervenes when the chaos begins to affect business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Everyone's eyes are on Seth as he tries to prove he is worthy of being in charge, while also attempting to keep calm as the pressure begins to mount.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth makes a costly mistake that threatens to land the business in financial disaster. While he tries to correct it, Ashley spills the beans to Les.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les works at breakneck pace to customise a $20,000 ring, but Seth is furious when Ashley unjustifiably derails the sale.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team members are intrigued when 18th-century engravings of the Spanish Armada arrive at the shop, along with explicit wax recordings from the 1890s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team test drives a 1950s Chrysler Town & Country Newport, and a cubist painting by New Zealand artist Louise Henderson arrives at the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A first edition of The Adventures of Bob Hope comic gets Rick and Chum chuckling, and an ancient Egyptian mummy mask gets Corey all wrapped up.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Limited edition Batman and Joker Bolin Guitars swoop into the shop, and a bronze sculpture by ML Snowden also grabs the attention.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Items arriving in the show include an 1800s Colt revolver, an antique Chinese fingernail guard, a life mask of Abraham Lincoln and a Playboy magazine used in the movie Forrest Gump.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Madonna's 1988 day planner arrives at the shop, along with a 1910 phrenology head, but it remains to be seen which is the most valuable.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Among the oddities brought in is a 1950s toy lie detector, and Chum must decide whether to make an honest offer when he takes charge of the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A shower curtain signed by Anthony Perkins from Alfred Hitchcock's classic 1960 thriller Psycho, arrives at the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is intrigued when handwritten lyrics to My Country, 'Tis of Thee arrive at the shop, but it remains to be seen whether they are the real deal.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An autographed picture of John Belushi and a Jim Henson puppet arrive in the shop, but it remains to be seen if any of them are worth big money.

programme.title: Mega Pit Stops
programme.desc: A look at how enormous vehicles, such as planes, trains and ships, are repaired and returned to service within incredibly short timeframe.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: A team of scientists and investigators looks into the many sighting of the mysterious Sasquatch to discover if Bigfoot could actually exist.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught On Camera
programme.sub-title: The Seedy Texas Motel Poltergeist and More
programme.desc: A travelling businessman encounters poltergeist activity in his Texas motel room and a UFO is spotted over one of the holiest sites on Earth.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick and Marty Lagina double down their efforts to locate the elusive Money Pit. A significant and unexpected discovery strengthens Oak Island's connection to the Knights Templar.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Sixteen-year-old Storm tries to make his mark with Dwane and the crew. The team collect a slimy alternative to urchin, and Dwane faces a boisterous seven gill shark..

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Sean Lock and Rich Hall for more interesting answers on subjects beginning with the letter E in the mind-boggling comedy quiz show.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, John Robins and Holly Walsh join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. First shown in July 2016.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Mind-boggling comedy quiz show in which Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Jimmy Carr, Rob Brydon and Bill Bailey for more interesting answers on subjects beginning with the letter E, including engineering.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Sean Lock and Rich Hall for more interesting answers on subjects beginning with the letter E in the mind-boggling comedy quiz show.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Anita Rani, Chris Ramsey, Janet Ellis and Jamie Theakston compete in Double Points Friday, and their scores are tallied from the week resulting in an overall champion being crowned.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, John Robins and Holly Walsh join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. First shown in July 2016.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Kia Cee'd through a rigorous but peculiar road test featuring eels, curry, a rock legend, an American police officer and an unusual game of rugby involving James May. Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the Mastretta MXT, but worries about the repercussions of a comment he made in a previous episode about Mexico, the sports car's country of manufacture. Plus, three high-performance hatchbacks are driven with gusto around the test track, and Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton gets a second chance to smash the lap record.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: In one of the most unusual auctions yet, Sean invites people to bid for the contents of abandoned lorries.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The Alvarado brothers stumble across an interesting collectible, while Brandon and Lori bid on a storage facility for pets.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: The team heads up the Murray River in Victoria to meet Mingo, a collector who specialises in FJ Holdens and vintage Indian and Harley Davidson motorcycles.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank and Danielle visit a former trading post and a hospital that houses a collection of medical paraphernalia.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A 999 call from a teenager sparks a race against time for Nadiene and volunteer Matt. When confronted with an aggressive man, the pair are forced to hit their emergency buttons.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith engages in a high-speed pursuit after spotting a car being driven with a flat tyre. Even after the tyre disintegrates at 90mph, the driver still refuses to stop.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith gets lost on the roads of Derbyshire looking for a wanted man. He spots a dodgy van driver who is on the road without insurance, and is forced to make a crucial decision.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A 12-year-old boy turns up at one of the bridges on his own, claiming that his mother has been kidnapped by the cartels and he has been living on the streets.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond try to solve the problems that increasingly complex cars pose to an ageing population. They design a vehicle for elderly people and put it to the test in Dorset with the help of three pensioners. Meanwhile, James May gets acquainted with a revamped Range Rover in London before pitting the luxurious off-roader against an autonomous military machine in Nevada. Actor James McAvoy tackles the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier leads two teams of car buffs in an engineering contest against pro-driver Shane Lynch's supercar. This time, they take on the iconic Land Rover Discovery in an off-road hill climb. To defeat such a thoroughbred, the teams need to demonstrate their innovation and imagination.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Grumpy comic Jack Dee, footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker and actress Fay Ripley reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include white-van drivers, competitive parents and people who tell the truth.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Outdoor survival expert Ray Mears, TV presenter Fiona Bruce and comedienne Katherine Ryan tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include caravans, cushions on beds and Cheryl.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites another three celebrities to reveal their pet hates in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Actor, comedian and game-show host Alexander Armstrong reveals how he finds certain cocktail ingredients pointless, athlete Kelly Holmes is fed up of being given the runaround by the M25, and veteran sports commentator Henry Blofeld argues that people talking to him at breakfast simply isn't cricket.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack's not having much luck with lights these days, whether it's the fizzling sign at the start of this show, the blackout during his recent Sheffield gig, or the dimly lit area at the start of this seventh series. Lee and Lucy have enjoyed a spot of culture at their local cinema, but the sparkle of a French movie is soon diminished when the romantic walk home finds them in an imposing underpass. She has her handbag stolen by a bunch of cocky youths from under his nose. Given the fact the layabout failed to protect her, or come up with an accurate description of their muggers, Lee feels the urge to prove his manliness, but will a spell at the local boxing ring be a help or a hindrance? Sally Bretton and Katy Wix also star.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A wealthy new couple move into the block and soon find out that sharing a building with Lee and Lucy is anything but straightforward. The fun begins when Lee somehow manages to bag an invitation to a christening party being thrown by the couple - sending him and Lucy on a last-minute gift-buying trip, during which they make every wrong decision humanly possible to find the perfect present for the baby who seems to have everything. Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden join the cast, with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy decides she wants to have a baby, but what she didn't expect was for the whole family to take a personal interest in the conception. Lee thinks he should be the one, of course - so he can't believe it when she reveals she is planning to have the child with another man. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star, with Katy Wix, Bobby Ball, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, John Robins and Holly Walsh join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. First shown in July 2016.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Carl Donnelly, Jo Caulfield and Milton Jones join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz from June 2012.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Crystal Maze host Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from May 2018, with comedian Roisin Conaty and broadcaster Robert Peston joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Questions regarding the authenticity of the Jehoash Tablet, a religious artifact containing an ancient inscription.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Egyptologist David Rohl searches for the location of the Tower of Babel, a Biblical structure which first appeared in the Book of Genesis.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Calls to reinvestigate the suspicious death of King Ludwig of Bavaria in 1886, who died three days after he was declared insane and deposed from the throne.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians reveal how the railways transformed the British diet, rescuing a nation that was struggling to feed itself. Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn discover how the mass transportation of livestock gave birth to the traditional British roast, and Ruth Goodman is in Whitby, which became a thriving fishing town thanks to the North Yorkshire Moors Railway supplying its kippers. Plus, Hampshire's watercress line, which brought nutritional salad to the masses, and how the use of steam-powered engines revolutionised production at Britain's oldest brewery.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians take a trip on the Flying Scotsman, arguably the most famous locomotive in the world, along its original route connecting London and Edinburgh - the two most important financial capitals of the Empire. Peter Ginn explores how the railways revolutionised the delivery of mail across Britain, he and Alex Langlands learn about the first electronic communication service - more than 100 years before the arrival of email - and Ruth finds out about the role of the wheeltapper. Plus, why do some railway clocks have more than one minute hand?.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians explore the life of the South Devon branch line before the Beeching cuts of the 1960s. Peter Ginn joins a footplate crew and receives coal-shovelling tips from a veteran steam engine driver of 63 years' experience, and with Alex he learns about one of Scotland's most lucrative exports. Ruth Goodman finds out about the dangers involved in working on the Victorian railways, and how those who lost limbs were catered for by a dedicated prosthetics workshop. She also discovers how the railways came to the rescue when a deadly disease wiped out almost the entire stock of London cattle.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The team discover how the combination of increased leisure time and affordable rail transport brought a new kind of freedom for working-class Victorians. Ruth Goodman travels along the south Devon coast from Paignton to Kingswear, where she helps prepare a paddle steamer for a journey up the River Dart, while at Swanage, Peter Ginn finds out what it was like to work on the excursion trains and the impact mass tourism had on the area.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: High-definition cameras and aerial photography techniques are used to explore the archipelago, which is rich in wildlife and made famous by Charles Darwin's On the Origin of the Species. This programme focuses on the geological history of the islands through the evidence of volcanic eruptions and examines what makes it unique. Tilda Swinton narrates.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Examining the lesser-known parts of the islands and the species that have successfully evolved to suit the environment. The programme discovers how tortoise shells have changed shape, flowers have turned yellow to attract bees, and finches have become warblers. Plus, how flightless cormorants are still hunting underwater. Narrated by Tilda Swinton.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: An insight into how creatures adapt to the islands' extremes of weather, including iguanas that climb more than 1,000 metres to lay eggs, fish forced to rely on the shade provided by mangroves, and seals that survive on exposed shorelines by taking shelter in lava grottos.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: High-definition cameras and aerial photography techniques are used to explore the archipelago, which is rich in wildlife and made famous by Charles Darwin's On the Origin of the Species. This programme focuses on the geological history of the islands through the evidence of volcanic eruptions and examines what makes it unique. Tilda Swinton narrates.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Examining the lesser-known parts of the islands and the species that have successfully evolved to suit the environment. The programme discovers how tortoise shells have changed shape, flowers have turned yellow to attract bees, and finches have become warblers. Plus, how flightless cormorants are still hunting underwater. Narrated by Tilda Swinton.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: An insight into how creatures adapt to the islands' extremes of weather, including iguanas that climb more than 1,000 metres to lay eggs, fish forced to rely on the shade provided by mangroves, and seals that survive on exposed shorelines by taking shelter in lava grottos.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Performances by punk and new wave acts on the music show in 1977, including the Stranglers and the Jam, plus the continuing power of disco exemplified by Donna Summer's I Feel Love, the reggae of Bob Marley and pub rock by acts such as Eddie and the Hot Rods. Insight into performing on the programme comes from musicians including John Otway, JJ Burnel of the Stranglers, Paul Cook of the Sex Pistols, members of Darts and the Adverts, as well as contributions from Nicky Wire, Alexis Petridis and Pete Paphides.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Documentary about the change of musical direction in 1978, when pop singles were slowly ousted by disco, punk and new wave artists. The programme features contributions by members of the Boomtown Rats, Squeeze, Boney M and Sham 69 - among others - and archive performances by the likes of Elvis Costello, the Undertones, Ian Dury and the Blockheads and the Jam.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Tower of London
programme.desc: An exploration of British landmarks, beginning with a look at the Tower of London - which has served as a castle, a jail and a place of execution.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Kensington Palace in London, which began life as an early 17th-century Jacobean mansion before becoming a palace fit for the monarchy, and was the brainchild of Christopher Wren.

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor takes a vintage school bus trip, rides a San Francisco cable car, meets a legendary motorcycle club and takes to the air in a vintage military helicopter.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Two skulls are found during the construction of a new bypass, and the detective investigates a possible link to the theft of poisonous snakes from a Glasgow research laboratory. Drama, starring Mark McManus, Blythe Duff and Dougray Scott.

programme.title: Mansfield Park
programme.desc: First of a six-part Jane Austen adaptation, starring Sylvestra Le Touzel as an impoverished young woman adopted into the household of her reluctant wealthy relatives.

credits.actor: Sylvestra Le Touzel as an impoverished young woman adopted into the household of her reluctant wealthy relatives

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The past begins to catch up with 12th-century sleuth Brother Cadfael as he investigates the case of a wealthy landowner murdered shortly after disinheriting his son. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi, Sean Pertwee, Peter Copley, Sophie Lawrence and Julian Firth.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer is asked to furnish a restaurant, but the items he acquires turn out to be stolen. To make matters worse, the owners turn up for the establishment's opening night. John Wells guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer is asked to track down an itinerant painter who holds the key to a shameful secret. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Despatched by Munro to kill a French colonel, Sharpe is wounded in battle and hovers at death's door - but Harper and a mute nun nurse him back to health. Once recovered, he sets out in search of vengeance with a newly forged sword. Period adventure, starring Sean Bean and Daragh O'Malley.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Bomber learns his daughter has run away, and immediately flies home to lend his wife moral support - unaware the young lady in question is winging her way to Dusseldorf to be with him. Comedy drama, starring Pat Roach, Tim Healy, Gary Holton and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Brenda makes it clear that she thinks Neville is living it up in Germany just as a leather-clad local girl, whom he merely shared a taxi with, accuses him of assaulting her. Cult comedy drama, starring Kevin Whately, Tim Healy and Julia Tobin.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Spin-off from Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries, set in the 1960s, following Miss Fisher's niece, who sets out to investigate what happened to her aunt. In the first of a two-part story, Peregrine Fisher arrives in Melbourne to collect her inheritance from her aunt, Phryne Fisher. Wanting to be part of the same Adventuresses' Club as her aunt, Peregrine decides to follow in Phryne's footsteps and solve the murder of a dead model at a bridal fashion show. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mysterious disappearance of an old friend leads Father Brown and Sid on a quest to find the mythical Lannington Rosary, and an old adversary, seemingly back from the dead, must be trusted to help. Mark Williams stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Armed only with a telescope, the priest hopes that a broken leg will not prevent him from solving the mystery surrounding the death of a member of Kembleford's Women's Institute. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack, Nancy Carroll and Tom Chambers.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: A groom-to-be is shot dead while on a hunting excursion during his stag trip. Though apparently an accident, none of his accompanying friends will admit to firing the bullet. Neill Rea stars.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Julia refuses to accept the blame when one of her patients dies after surgery, and her investigations reveal an unusual pattern of deaths among alcoholics on the ward.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Fantasy drama, starring John Simm as a detective who ends up in a coma while pursuing a serial killer - and when he comes round, he finds he has somehow been transported back to 1973. As he attempts to uncover what has happened to him, he must also contend with the macho behaviour of his Sweeneyesque colleagues, as well as a murderer whose crimes are oddly similar to the one he was investigating in his own time.

credits.actor: John Simm as a detective who ends up in a coma while pursuing a serial killer -
he finds he has somehow been transported back to 1973

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam learns Gene has planted evidence on a notorious armed robber, and decides to let him go. However, the crook then continues his crime spree, critically wounding a cleaner from the police station in the process. The idealistic detective begins to question whether his colleague's approach might be justified - but fears his doubts could affect his chances of returning to the 21st century.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The beleaguered barrister puts aside his domestic problems to defend a prostitute on the charge of murdering a high-profile businessman - a tricky case made all the more difficult by the discovery that she has many enemies, all of them determined to blacken her character. Drama, starring John Thaw.

programme.title: Sky News @ Breakfast
programme.desc: Join Stephen Dixon and Gillian Joseph for all the news from home and abroad, the latest sport and weather, and a review of the weekend papers.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Following Trisha Goddard's elimination last week, the remaining 11 celebrities and their professional partners perform routines from famous musicals. They will be hoping to get a high score from judges Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman - not to mention plenty of viewer votes - and avoid having to compete in the skate-off. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny takes on one of the UK's toughest obstacle courses, but can he beat the clock and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry are in charge of an old cuckoo clock, and Tuffy wants to be friends with the wooden bird inside.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Weasel tests out Fizz's latest invention, a three-piece swimsuit to make beachgoers look chic. Magoo mistakes him for the President..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket becomes inconsolable when Scrapper goes missing. Mr. Bean investigates..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave wants to learn to play the drums at school, but is given the recorder. With a talent show around the corner, Dave gets practising..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Virgil and Gordon must rescue a trapped urban-explorer in a trash mine, while Brains attempts a risky mission. Guest starring Sheridan Smith.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by guests Julia Bradbury and Jodie Kidd, as well as chefs Michel Roux Sr and Sat Bains, and Extreme Cake Maker Rosie Dummer. Oz Clarke presents a guide to the best wines to serve for Chinese New Year.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up a plant-based lasagne, a vegan breakfast - including smoky barbecue beans, vegan scrambled eggs and a meat-free alternative to bacon - and salted caramel apple crumble with custard. The duo also try to convince meat-loving weatherman Alex Beresford that their big bosh burger is as good as the meaty ones he loves, and for their snack hacks, they show off their recipes for nut butters.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle recalculates the height of England's highest mountain, Scafell Pike, with the team from the Ordnance Survey. Liz Bonnin visits Cheshire's Lyme Park to witness one of autumn's greatest natural wonders - the red deer rut. Plus, chef Gino D'Acampo invites viewers to his adopted home county of Hertfordshire to find woodland ingredients for his mushroom bruschetta.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Cheltenham
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 2.25 Cotswold Steeple Chase and 3.35 Gallardhomes.com Cleeve Hurdle, and races at 1.50 and 3.00 from Cheltenham. Plus, races from 2.05, 2.40 and 3.15 at Doncaster. With analysis from Ruby Walsh and Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Alice Plunkett, Matt Chapman, Oli Bell and Luke Harvey, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the show's most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shepherd, in which the the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as another four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but anyone caught by the Chaser is out for good, leaving fewer players to team up and play in the final chase.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants Chris Hoy, Martine McCutcheon and Faye Tozer to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Donny Osmond joins regular panellists Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross and Davina McCall on this edition of the singing contest, as they attempt to guess the identities of the six famous faces performing from behind bizarre costumes. At the end of this week's show, a fifth singer will be unmasked and eliminated. Hosted by Joel Dommett.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity coaches seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor is the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon
programme.desc: The funnyman takes Spice Girl Mel B to do her big weekly food shop and has a good chat along the way, as well as visiting a London tailor with Jimmy Carr.

programme.title: Bridesmaids (2011)
programme.desc: A disorganised woman is asked to be maid of honour at her best friend's wedding. Taking charge of the prenuptial bridal celebrations, she resolves to give her pal and accompanying bridesmaids the time of their lives, but as her efforts slide into chaos she finds the wife of the groom's boss is keen to usurp her position. Comedy, with Kristen Wiig, Rose Byrne and Melissa McCarthy.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How skyline logging sources Vancouver's most elusive trees. Plus, how ordinary clay is transformed into intricate tiles in a Spanish workshop.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer hopes to purchase a Lotus Elise, but is unsure how to add value to the car and enlists mechanic Edd China's help.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells classic Italian sports cars, including a 1971 Ferrari Daytona Spyder, at an auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.sub-title: Amelia Island: Get Some, Give Some
programme.desc: Wayne Carini auctions off a 1949 Mercury Woodie wagon and a rare 1961 Austin-Healey 3000 Mk I BN7, for a client.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, beginning with collisions from highways around the world, including an unimaginable three-way accident.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Footage of heart-pounding getaways, including cabs running wild on the streets, and unfortunate and dramatic miscalculations of load height.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Rain causes a series of spectacular race car crashes, a tornado destroys a town, a freeway collapses, a jet crashes at an air show and a drag boat crashes at 200mph.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Clips of a fire at a chemical plant, a racing driver trapped in a burning car, a pilot tipped from a hot air balloon during a show, a train derailment and a stunt jump gone awry.

programme.title: Heli-Loggers
programme.desc: Documentary following Gord Closson, at the helm of one of the biggest logging projects in Canadian history, who uses a helicopter to harvest cedar trees worth millions of dollars.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: A teenager calls in the team to help transform his father's 1967 Chevy Chevelle, which has become sadly neglected.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: An additional $15million in crab sends the fleet into a fishing frenzy and the crews of the Time Bandit and Wizard must put a decade-old rivalry behind them.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: An insight into the design of the Mercedes AMG GT, which was conceived as a faster, lighter and smaller hand-built supercar to rival the venerable Porsche 911.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to buy a Ford Sierra Cosworth on a budget of only £5,000, before handing it over to mechanic Edd China for extensive renovation work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a budget Nissan Skyline supercar and Edd China sets about transforming it into a home-made drift racer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer hopes to purchase a Lotus Elise, but is unsure how to add value to the car and enlists mechanic Edd China's help.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer bags a bargain example of one of his dream cars - a Ford Fiesta XR2 - but there is only £1,000 to spend on repairs.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China take on their first Honda, but finding a cheap S2000 is hard and Mike gambles on a car that has already had more than £4,000 spent on it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Mazda coupe that appears to have nothing wrong with it, so he decides to give expert mechanic Edd China the task of making a good car even better.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: A team of international investigators conducts a definitive inquiry into the possibility that Adolf Hitler may have survived the conclusion of the Second World War, and escaped from Germany before he could be apprehended by Allied forces. The investigation is inspired by an FBI cold case from 70 years ago, which saw top US officials, including FBI director J Edgar Hoover, considering the possibility that the German Fuhrer's death may have been fabricated to give him a chance to flee from justice.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: A vital clue on Snake Island pushes the treasure hunters to enter the perilous Paraguayan jungle, and a historic artefact brings them closer to a valuable find.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Meeting the people who drive some of the heaviest and least manoeuvrable vehicles along some of Australia's toughest highways.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The team take on a Japanese sports car legend - the Toyota Supra. These cars have been modified countless times, so how can they make theirs stand out?.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland head to the Midlands to look at a Swedish classic - the Volvo Amazon. When Paul falls for an early Toyota MR2, he seeks a way to convince Drew it will turn a profit.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Mechanical failure and a mini twister hit Ally as he tries to bale a £10,000 grass harvest. Absent staff and a huge pie order put the heat on Ian and Stef in their farm bakery.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard is on the hunt for rare objects in a Devizes dealership inside a pub. And, in Leigh-on-Sea, he finds an array of unusual objects salvaged from building sites.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League. including Stoke City v Swansea City.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton sells an Australian museum a Second World War tank destroyer worth half a million pounds, which still needs a barrel.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them..

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How a drug-dependent landlady killed and buried seven victims for their social security cheques. Plus, a serial murderer is convicted on the basis of DNA evidence, 12 years after committing the crime.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The case of Erin Caffey, whose life started resembling that of Nicole Walker, a character played by Reese Witherspoon in James Foley's 1996 film, Fear. Like Nicole, when Erin began dating the town's bad boy, her parents disapproved and forbid her from seeing him again. The love affair tore the family apart.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murders of Michael and Valerie Miller, shot dead in the kitchen of their Maine home in November 2009. Nathaniel Nightingale, a friend of the couple's son, claimed his gun went off by accident when he shot Michael Miller, and that he shot Valerie in panic.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Agents investigating the death of a New York petrol station mogul infiltrate the crime ring responsible and discover a Mafia world of brutality and murder.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A cat's injury shocks the staff, and when members of the team investigate further they find more abused animals.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown pays a visit to Kyabram Vet Clinic in the state of Victoria to lend a hand to an old friend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman who recently lost her father searches for the perfect wedding dress. Plus, a look at what happens when a bride-to-be changes her mind at the last minute.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Aspiring country music star Whitney Duncan wants a romantic lace gown that gives her some curves, while a bride with a larger-than-life personality looks for a dress to match.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
programme.desc: Lacey wants a dress that will show off her very large back tattoo, but her mother wants it fully covered.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A mini pig who loves to dig is in trouble with local authorities, a homeless shih-tzu cross is in a critical condition, and a baby cheetah must pass a series of tests.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is called to Cairns Rainforest Station Nature Park to check on the broken jaw of Agro the crocodile, who has managed to kill all nine of the other crocs in his pond.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Bedridden man James is barely able to move his legs, and may only have months to live unless he undergoes bypass surgery.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Despite a solid support network of her boyfriend and cousin, Tiffany finds it difficult to break the cycle of depressed eating when her two room-mates refuse to help her.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Cameras follow Tiffany, who finds it difficult to break the cycle of depressed eating.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Reuben attends a major press party on his last night in New York. However, nerves set in as he must give a speech in front of the city's biggest beauty bloggers.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Reuben does some work experience with his granfather in Bampa's old doughnut van. Later, at London Fashion Week. they meet up with make-up star, The Plastic Boy.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: A Dress Worth Saying I Do
programme.desc: A bride who survived a car crash and a woman whose body has changed drastically visit the shop.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: A Bridal Change of the Heart
programme.desc: Country singer Naomi Judd visits the shop to help one of her employees choose a gown. A bride decides she wants to go down the aisle in a short dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: No Such Thing As a Country Dress
programme.desc: A customer decides she wants to change her look for the big day, but her entourage has other ideas. Another bride decides she wants a modest dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride helping her fiance recover from an accident has had no time to think about her wedding dress - so supermodel Niki Taylor helps her to choose a gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lori and Monte surprise super fan and bride-to-be Katie with an extra special bridal shopping experience at the salon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer needs to lose 20 to 30 pounds to fit into a dress, while another bride tries to convince Lori to let her try on a gown that is beyond her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer faces a challenging fitting, and another bride disagrees with her mother about how her dress should look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Magan wants a gown with colour, but her unique choice has her family seeing red. Bride Monica is looking for a princess dress to honour her late mother's wishes.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: After an extremely traumatic death of his daughter, Max's wife summons Theresa Caputo to help ease painful guilty and finally get some peace.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo is asked to investigate hauntings, but finds dealing with spirits in a different way terrifying.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: A brother riddled with remorse and anger wishes to reconnect with her deceased sibling. Theresa Caputo knows this will be a very tough assignment.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo, husband Larry and daughter Victoria head enjoy a day out with their dogs, which leads to a surprising chance encounter.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Terry's hoarding has put her relationship with husband Bill in jeopardy, so she faces the daunting task of clearing their home to save her marriage.

programme.title: Murder By Numbers
programme.desc: Within a month, four men in Orange County, southern California, were brutally stabbed by a mysterious man. Officers contemplated whether the killings were connected to a double murder that occurred months earlier.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: Harold Shipman was a much-loved doctor. Millions watched the GP speaking on TV discussing the benefits of care, not knowing he'd already killed dozens of patients.

programme.title: Hunting the Paedophiles: Inside the National Crime Agency
programme.desc: In 2013, the newly created National Crime Agency uncovered one of the biggest online child abuse cases ever seen in the UK, with hundreds of teenage boys having been duped into sending indecent images of themselves to what they thought were teenage girls online. Many were blackmailed into sending more and more pictures, with chilling threats made against them by an unknown abuser. This film documents the hunt to find the culprit, which would take investigators halfway across the world, and the race against time for social workers to try to locate and protect all the victims, the number of which keeps rising.
